cards.name: Angel of Light
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavorText: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

cards.name: Archangel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavorText: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Bargain
cards.text:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
cards.flavorText: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavorText: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

cards.name: Border Guard
cards.flavorText: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Champion Lancer
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
cards.flavorText: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

cards.name: Charging Paladin
cards.text: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

cards.name: Devoted Hero
cards.flavorText: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

cards.name: Devout Monk
cards.text: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavorText: Discipline wears many robes.

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavorText: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

cards.name: False Peace
cards.text: Target player skips all combat phases of their next turn.
cards.flavorText: Mutual consent is not required for war.

cards.name: Foot Soldiers
cards.flavorText: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

cards.name: Gerrard's Wisdom
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
cards.flavorText: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavorText:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—*The Bible*, Proverbs 15:33

cards.name: Loyal Sentry
cards.text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

rulings.text: Loyal Sentry and the creature it blocks are destroyed before combat damage is dealt. The blocked creature is destroyed even if Loyal Sentry leaves the battlefield before its triggered ability resolves.

cards.name: Path of Peace
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
cards.flavorText:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

rulings.text: You are a creature’s owner if the card representing it began the game in your deck, or if it’s a token that entered the battlefield under your control. If Path of Peace targets a creature that you own but an opponent controls, you’ll gain 4 life.
If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Path of Peace tries to resolve, the spell doesn’t resolve. No player gains life.

cards.name: Righteous Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

cards.name: Righteous Fury
cards.text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

cards.name: Royal Falcon
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

cards.name: Royal Trooper
cards.text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, *Phaedra*

cards.name: Sacred Nectar
cards.text: You gain 4 life.
cards.flavorText:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed, And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

cards.name: Steadfastness
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavorText: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavorText: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

cards.name: Veteran Cavalier
cards.text: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavorText:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

cards.name: Coral Eel
cards.flavorText: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Denizen of the Deep
cards.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player’s next untap step. They can still can untap during other player’s untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.name: Extinguish
cards.text: Counter target sorcery spell.

cards.name: Eye Spy
cards.text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into their graveyard.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavorText: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

cards.name: Ingenious Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavorText: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o’-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavorText: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

cards.name: Owl Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavorText: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

cards.name: Piracy
cards.text: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.
cards.flavorText: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.

cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can’t lose life, that player can’t exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won’t happen.

cards.name: Ransack
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

cards.name: Relearn
cards.text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavorText: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavorText: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Sea Eagle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, you put it into your hand.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavorText: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavorText: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

cards.name: Tidings
cards.text: Draw four cards.
cards.flavorText:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, *Hamlet*

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavorText: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavorText:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

rulings.text: If multiple “extra turn” effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.name: Touch of Brilliance
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavorText: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I *do* have."

cards.name: Undo
cards.text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner’s hands.

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavorText: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavorText:
The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up.
—Chinese proverb

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake, *The Marriage of Heaven and Hell*

cards.name: Wind Sail
cards.text: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.

cards.name: Abyssal Horror
cards.text:
Flying
When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Ancient Craving
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavorText: Knowledge demands sacrifice.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavorText: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

cards.name: Bog Raiders
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavorText: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavorText: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

cards.name: Chorus of Woe
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavorText: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

cards.name: Dakmor Ghoul
cards.text: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavorText:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

cards.name: Dakmor Lancer
cards.text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavorText: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

cards.name: Dakmor Plague
cards.text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavorText: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

cards.name: Dakmor Scorpion
cards.flavorText: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe *around* your boot, but not *in* it.

cards.name: Dakmor Sorceress
cards.text: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Dark Offering
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavorText:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor

cards.name: Dread Reaper
cards.text:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A “creature card” is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.name: Grim Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle. You lose 3 life.
cards.flavorText:
One who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb

rulings.text: You don’t reveal the card you search for.

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavorText: The touch of death is never gentle.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.name: Howling Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Muck Rats
cards.flavorText:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavorText: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavorText: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavorText: A hiss before dying.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.name: Shrieking Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player discards a card.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavorText: Evil often dines alone.

cards.name: Stream of Acid
cards.text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.

cards.name: Wicked Pact
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

cards.name: Cinder Storm
cards.text: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

cards.name: Devastation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures and lands.
cards.flavorText: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavorText: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

cards.name: Fire Elemental
cards.flavorText: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

cards.name: Fire Tempest
cards.text: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Goblin Cavaliers
cards.flavorText: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

cards.name: Goblin Chariot
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavorText: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Commando
cards.text: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavorText: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.

cards.name: Goblin General
cards.text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

cards.name: Goblin Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Goblin Glider can't block.
cards.flavorText: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavorText: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

cards.name: Goblin Lore
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.flavorText:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."

cards.name: Goblin Mountaineer
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavorText: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.

cards.name: Goblin Settler
cards.text: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.flavorText: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.

cards.name: Hulking Goblin
cards.text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
cards.flavorText: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

cards.name: Hulking Ogre
cards.text: Hulking Ogre can't block.
cards.flavorText: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

cards.name: Jagged Lightning
cards.text: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.

cards.name: Last Chance
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavorText: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavorText: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

cards.name: Ogre Warrior
cards.flavorText: Assault and battery included.

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavorText: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent’s turn, that opponent’s creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.name: Scorching Spear
cards.text: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Thunder Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Trained Orgg
cards.flavorText: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them *what* to kill.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavorText: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavorText: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

cards.name: Volcanic Hammer
cards.text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavorText: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

cards.name: Alluring Scent
cards.text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
cards.flavorText: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

cards.name: Barbtooth Wurm
cards.flavorText: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

cards.name: Bull Hippo
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavorText: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavorText:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—*The Bible*, Mark 5:13

cards.name: Gorilla Warrior
cards.flavorText: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavorText: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

cards.name: Lone Wolf
cards.text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can’t split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned “as though it weren’t blocked”.

cards.name: Lynx
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavorText: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavorText: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavorText:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
*A Midsummer Night's Dream*

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavorText: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

cards.name: Nature's Cloak
cards.text: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
cards.flavorText: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.name: Norwood Archers
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavorText:
"'Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout

cards.name: Norwood Ranger
cards.flavorText: Some trees bear deadly fruit.

cards.name: Pride of Lions
cards.text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can’t split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned “as though it weren’t blocked”.

cards.name: Renewing Touch
cards.text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.flavorText: Death just encourages life the more.

cards.name: Silverback Ape
cards.flavorText: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

cards.name: Southern Elephant
cards.flavorText: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavorText:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . . The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, *In Memoriam*

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavorText: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.name: Sylvan Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

cards.name: Sylvan Yeti
cards.text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavorText: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can’t split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned “as though it weren’t blocked”.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.name: Whiptail Wurm
cards.flavorText: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

cards.name: Whirlwind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures with flying.

cards.name: Wild Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavorText: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

cards.name: Willow Elf
cards.flavorText: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
